Product.name: ZST10 S2 Z-Wave Plus USB Stick

Value.label: IN1 Alarm Cancellation Delay
Value.Help: Flood alarm cancellation delay. Additional delay after a flood alarm has ceased. The parameter allows you to specify additional time, after which the flood alarm is cancelled once its violation has ceased.

Value.label: Acoustic and visual signals
Value.Help: Acoustic and visual signals in case of flooding.

Value.label: Type of alarm frame for association group 1
Value.Help: Type of alarm frame for association group 1, activated by flood sensor. The parameter allows to specify the type of alarm frame or to force transmission of control commands (BASIC_SET)

Value.label: Forced Level of Dimming group 1
Value.Help: Value of the parameter specifying the forced level of dimming / opening sun blinds when comes "switch on" / "open" command to devices from association group no. 1. In the case of alarm frames the alarm priority is specified. Possible parameter settings: (1 to 99) and 255. Value of 255 makes it possible to activate the device when using the Dimmer module it means activating the device and setting it to the previous stored condition, e.g. when Dimmer is set to 30%, then deactivated, and then reactivated using command 255, it will automatically be set to the previous condition, i.e. 30%.

Value.label: Deactivate transmission of frame cancelling alarm
Value.Help: Deactivating transmission of the frame cancelling the alarm or the control frame deactivating the device (Basic). It allows for disabling the deactivation function or the alarm cancellation function for devices associated with the appropriate input of the Fibaro Sensor. NOTE: Information concerning alarm violation or activation commands for devices from association groups are always sent.

Value.label: Interval between successive readings of temperature sensors
Value.Help: Interval between successive readings of temperature from all sensors connected to the device in seconds. Note: taking temperature readings from the sensor does not result in sending a temperature condition report to the central hub.

Value.label: Insensitiveness to temperature changes.
Value.Help: Insensitiveness to temperature changes. This is the maximum acceptable difference between the last reported temperature and the current temperature taken from the sensor. If the temperatures differ by the set value or more, then a report with the current temperature value is sent to the device assigned to association group no. 3. Intervals between taking readings from sensors are specified by parameter no. 10. Possible parameter settings:1 to 1000 [each 0.01oC] [0.01oC to 10.00oC].

Value.label: Transmitting the alarm or control frame broadcast mode
Value.Help: Transmitting the alarm or control frame in "broadcast" mode (i.e. to all devices within range), information sent in this mode is not repeated by the mesh network. NOTE: If the broadcast mode of information transmission is activated for a given channel, then transmission of information in singlecast mode to devices assigned to the association group of this channel is deactivated.

Value.label: Low temperature alarm threshold.
Value.Help: The parameter stores a temperature value, below which LED indicator blinks with a colour determined by Parameter 61 settings. By default the LED indicator blinks blue. Possible parameter settings:-10000 to 10000 [each 0.01oC] [-100oC to 100oC].

Value.label: High temperature alarm threshold.
Value.Help: The parameter stores a temperature value, above which LED indicator blinks with a colour determined by Parameter 62 settings. By default the LED indicator blinks red. Possible parameter settings:-10000 to 10000 [each 0.01oC] [-100oC to 100oC].

Value.label: Low temperature alarm indicator colour.
Value.Help: The parameter stores RGB colour value.

Value.label: High temperature alarm indicator colour.
Value.Help: The parameter stores RGB colour value.

Value.label: Managing a LED indicator under standard operation.
Value.Help: Parameter determines LED indicator's operation. Set to 0 turns the indicator off, saving battery life.

Item.label: LED indicates temperature (blink) every Temperature Measurement Interval (Parameter 10, constant power + battery) or Wake Up Interval (battery)
LED indicates temperature constantly, only in constant power mode.

Value.label: Temperature measurement compensation.
Value.Help: Parameter stores a temperature value to be added to or deducted from the current temperature measured by the internal temperature sensor in order to compensate the difference between air temperature and the temperature at floor level. Possible parameter settings:-10000 to 10000 [each 0.01oC] [-100oC to 100oC].

Value.label: Alarm frame sent to group 2 (tamper/tilt).
Value.Help: The device is able to turn on alarms resulting from sensors vibrations, e.g. when the sensor is moved, or the TMP button is released. Group 2 association alarms are not cancelled.

Item.label: Button and movement tamper alarms ACTIVE

Value.label: Visual and audible alarm duration
Value.Help: Parameter determines a time period after which alarm will become 'quiet' - still active but the device will go into battery saving mode. Visual or acoustic alarm will be reactivated after time period specified in Parameter 76. When alarm status ceases, alarm will be turned off immediately. Value of 0 means visual and acoustic alarms are active indefinitely. In battery power mode the device will never go to sleep which may shorten battery life significantly.

Value.label: Alarm frame/basic set frame retransmission time
Value.Help: Parameter determines a time period after which an alarm frame will be retransmitted. Value of 0 cancels an alarm frame retransmission.

Value.label: Flood sensor functionality turned off.
Value.Help: Allows for turning off the internal flood sensor. Tamper and internal temperature sensors will remain active.

Product.name: ZCombo Smoke and Carbon Monoxide Detector

Value.label: Send double alarm messages
Value.Help: Causes the device to send double alarm messages.

Value.label: Temperature Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: The Temperature Reporting Threshold Configuration Set Command sets the reporting threshold for changes in the ambient temperature as detected by the thermostat.

Value.label: HVAC Settings
Value.Help: Bits 0 - 7 -> HVAC Setup: Normal (0x01) or Heat Pump (0x02) Bits 8 - 11 -> Number of Auxiliary Stages (Heat Pump) / Number of Heat Stages (Normal) Bits 12 - 15 -> Aux Setup: Gas (0x01) or Electric (0x02) Bits 16 - 23 -> Number of Heat Pump Stages Bits 24 - 31 -> Number of Cool Stages

HVAC: Heat Pump, Aux Stages: 1, Aux Setup: Gas, Heat Pump Stages: 2, Cool Stages: 2
HVAC: Normal, Aux Stages: 2, Aux Setup: Gas, Heat Pump Stages: 2, Cool Stages: 2
HVAC: Heat Pump, Aux Stages: 2, Aux Setup: Gas, Heat Pump Stages: 2, Cool Stages: 2

HVAC: Heat Pump, Aux Stages: 1, Aux Setup: Elec, Heat Pump Stages: 2, Cool Stages: 2
HVAC: Normal, Aux Stages: 2, Aux Setup: Elec, Heat Pump Stages: 2, Cool Stages: 2
HVAC: Heat Pump, Aux Stages: 2, Aux Setup: Elec, Heat Pump Stages: 2, Cool Stages: 2

Value.label: Utility Lock
Value.Help: The Utility Lock Configuration Set command enables or disables the utility lock. If the utility lock is enabled, the setpoint cannot be modified directly via the thermostat screen.

Value.label: C-Wire/Battery Status
Value.Help: 1 -> C-Wire 2 -> Battery

Value.label: Humidity Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: The Humidity Reporting Threshold Configuration Set Command sets the reporting threshold for changes in the relative humidity as detected by the thermostat.

Value.label: Auxiliary/Emergency heat
Value.Help: The Auxiliary/Emergency configuration command enables or disables auxiliary / emergency heating in the thermostat. Auxiliary / emergency heating is only available if the thermostat is configured in heat pump mode and with at least one stage of auxiliary heating. This command enables auxiliary / emergency heating when the thermostat is in Auto mode. The Thermostat Set Mode command with mode Auxiliary/Emergency Heat will enable emergency heating but only if the thermostat is in Heat mode. This command should only be used on thermostats that support Auxiliary/Emergency Heat thermostat mode.

Value.label: Thermostat Swing Temperature
Value.Help: Thermostat Swing Temperature configuration command sets the maximum allowed difference between ambient temperature and the set temperature.

Value.label: Thermostat Differential Temperature
Value.Help: (Set Only) The Thermostat Differential Temperature configuration command sets the differential temperature for multi-stage HVAC systems. The differential temperature delta defines when the thermostat will turn on additional stages. There are two differential temperatures, one for multistage cool systems and one for multistage heat systems. If the thermostat is not configured for multistage HVAC systems then these parameters have no effect.

Value.label: Thermostat Recovery Mode
Value.Help: The Thermostat Recovery Mode configuration command sets the HVAC recovery mode type. The recovery mode determines when additional HVAC stages are turned off as the ambient temperature returns to the target temperature. If the recovery mode is set to economy, the thermostat will turn off additional HVAC stages when the ambient temperature reaches the target temperature plus/minus the differential temperature. If the recovery mode is set to fast, the thermostat will leave all stages on (assuming they were already on) until the ambient temperature reaches the target temperature.

Value.label: Temperature Reporting Filter
Value.Help: The Temperature Reporting Filter configuration command sets upper and lower bounds of the ambient temperature reporting. The thermostat won't report ambient temperature changes if the ambient temperature falls between these bounds. For example, if the upper bound is 80F and the lower bound is 60F, the thermostat will not send SENSOR_MULTI_LEVEL_REPORTS for ambient temperature values between 60F and 80F. The thermostat will only send ambient temperature changes if the thermostat has been added to an association group (see Command Class Association) and the temperature reporting threshold is non-zero (see Temperature Reporting Threshold). Input in hexadecimal only like so: 0x09 0x05 0x09 0x0A. It must always have four 1 byte sized numbers. The first two bytes control the lower temperature bound for the Temperature Reporting Filter the last two control the upper temperature bound. The first byte in the byte pair always refers to temperature scale (Celsius 0x01 or Fahrenheit 0x09). While the second byte in each byte pair is the bound temperature. The max/min temp you can use is 127 degrees. To convert decimal to hex goto: https://www.binaryhexconverter.com/decimal-to-hex-converter or you can use the built in Windows calculator program in Programmer mode. If you mess up your thermostat copy and paste 0x09 0x00 0x09 0x00 (for a F Thermostat) or 0x01 0x00 0x01 0x00 (for a C Thermostat). This will remove any bounds.

Value.label: Simple UI Mode
Value.Help: Simple UI Mode Enable/Disable

Value.label: Multicast
Value.Help: Multicasting Enable/Disable

Value.label: Save Energy Mode Type
Value.Help: 1 -> Adjust by target delta 2 -> Least consuming point in the running program 3 -> Save energy absolute setpoint 255 -> Save Energy not supported

Value.label: LED Light
Value.Help: When shipped from the factory, the LED is set to turn ON when the connected light is turned OFF. This is the default setting and can be changed if your primary controller supports the node configuration function. To make the LED turn ON when the light is turned ON, change parameter 3s value to 1. To turn the LED OFF at all times, change parameter 3s value to 2.

Item.label: LED Light on when Z-Wave turned OFF
LED Light on when Z-Wave turned ON

Value.label: Led alarm reporting
Value.Help: Led alarm reporting

Value.label: Temperature and light reporting
Value.Help: Temperature and light reporting

Value.label: Temperature reporting
Value.Help: Does not affect temperature alarms

Value.label: Temperature reporting unit
Value.Help: Temperature reporting unit

Value.label: Temperature alarms
Value.Help: Temperature alarms

Value.label: Ambient light reporting
Value.Help: Ambient light reporting

Value.label: Leakage alarm
Value.Help: Leakage alarm

Value.label: Leakage alarm level
Value.Help: 1 to 100 (1 = almost dry, 100 = wet)

Value.label: Moisture reporting period
Value.Help: 0-120 (Hours between reports)

Value.label: Partner ID
Value.Help: Partner ID

Value.label: Device Tag
Value.Help: Device Tag

Value.label: Reset configuration settings to factory defaults
Value.Help: Reset to factory defaults.

Value.label: Wake up 10 minutes when batteries are inserted
Value.Help: Stay awake for 10 minutes after batteries are inserted

Value.label: On time
Value.Help: How long should the device associated to multi sensor keep state On before sending it Off command (if the value is bigger than 255, the value would be rounded to next integer in minutes)

Value.label: Enable Motion Sensor
Value.Help: Enable Motion Sensor

Value.label: Command Options
Value.Help: Which commands to send when PIR motion sensor triggered

Value.label: Reset #101-103
Value.Help: Reset to default parameters number 101-103. Any value other then 0 will initiate this reset.

Value.label: Group 1 Reports
Value.Help: Which reports need to send automatically in timing intervals for group 1. Bitsets: 0 -> Battery report, 5 -> Temperature, 6 -> Humidity, 7 -> Luminosity

Value.label: Group 2 Reports
Value.Help: Which reports need to send automatically in timing intervals for group 2. Bitsets: 0 -> Battery report, 5 -> Temperature, 6 -> Humidity, 7 -> Luminosity

Value.label: Group 3 Reports
Value.Help: Which reports need to send automatically in timing intervals for group 3. Bitsets: 0 -> Battery report, 5 -> Temperature, 6 -> Humidity, 7 -> Luminosity

Value.label: Reset #111-113
Value.Help: Reset to default parameters number 111-113. Any value other then 0 will initiate this reset.

Value.label: Group 1 Interval
Value.Help: The interval of sending report group 1. 1 to 2678400 seconds

Value.label: Group 2 Interval
Value.Help: The interval of sending report group 2. 1 to 2678400 seconds

Value.label: Group 3 Interval
Value.Help: The interval of sending report group 3. 1 to 2678400 seconds

Value.label: Reset to default
Value.Help: Reset to factory defaults.

Value.label: Country Voltage
Value.Help: Voltage to calculate wattage from amperage. US=120. EU,ANZ=240.

Value.label: Power changed
Value.Help: Automatic report only when power is changed.

Value.label: Wattage Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in wattage to induce a automatic report (whole HEM).

Value.label: Wattage Threshold C1
Value.Help: Threshold change in wattage to induce a automatic report (Clamp 1).

Value.label: Wattage Threshold C2
Value.Help: Threshold change in wattage to induce a automatic report (Clamp 2).

Value.label: Wattage Threshold C3
Value.Help: Threshold change in wattage to induce a automatic report (Clamp 3).

Value.label: Wattage Percentage Change
Value.Help: Percentage change in wattage to induce a automatic report (whole HEM).

Value.label: Wattage Percentage Change C1
Value.Help: Percentage change in wattage to induce a automatic report (Clamp 1).

Value.label: Wattage Percentage Change C2
Value.Help: Percentage change in wattage to induce a automatic report (Clamp 2).

Value.label: Wattage Percentage Change C3
Value.Help: Percentage change in wattage to induce a automatic report (Clamp 3).

Value.label: Accumulate energy
Value.Help: Accumulate energy when Battery Powered.

Value.label: USB powered
Value.Help: This byte denotes whether the product is using batteries (value = 0) or using USB power (value = 1).

Value.label: Reset #101-103
Value.Help: Reset to default parameters number 101-103. Any value other then 0 will initiate this reset.

Value.label: Group 1 Reports
Value.Help: Which reports need to send in group1. Format is as follows: Byte 1 (msb): Reserved Byte 2: Reserved Byte 3: Bit 7: reserved Bit 6: reserved Bit 5: Auto Send Meter Report (for kWh) at the group time interval (Clamp 3) Bit 4: Auto Send Meter Report (for kWh) at the group time interval (Clamp 2) Bit 3: Auto Send Meter Report (for kWh) at the group time interval (Clamp 1) Bit 2: Auto Send Meter Report (for watts) at the group time interval (Clamp 3) Bit 1: Auto Send Meter Report (for watts) at the group time interval (Clamp 2) Bit 0: Auto Send Meter Report (for watts) at the group time interval (Clamp 1) Byte 4 (lsb): Bit 7: reserved Bit 6: reserved Bit 5: reserved Bit 4: reserved Bit 3: Auto Send Meter Report (for kWh) at the group time interval (whole HEM) Bit 2: Auto Send Meter Report (for watts) at the group time interval (whole HEM) Bit 1: Auto Send Multilevel Sensor Report (for watts) at the group time interval (whole HEM) Bit 0: Auto Send Battery Report at the group time interval (whole HEM)

Value.label: Group 2 Reports
Value.Help: Which reports need to send in group2. Format is as follows: Byte 1 (msb): Reserved Byte 2: Reserved Byte 3: Bit 7: reserved Bit 6: reserved Bit 5: Auto Send Meter Report (for kWh) at the group time interval (Clamp 3) Bit 4: Auto Send Meter Report (for kWh) at the group time interval (Clamp 2) Bit 3: Auto Send Meter Report (for kWh) at the group time interval (Clamp 1) Bit 2: Auto Send Meter Report (for watts) at the group time interval (Clamp 3) Bit 1: Auto Send Meter Report (for watts) at the group time interval (Clamp 2) Bit 0: Auto Send Meter Report (for watts) at the group time interval (Clamp 1) Byte 4 (lsb): Bit 7: reserved Bit 6: reserved Bit 5: reserved Bit 4: reserved Bit 3: Auto Send Meter Report (for kWh) at the group time interval (whole HEM) Bit 2: Auto Send Meter Report (for watts) at the group time interval (whole HEM) Bit 1: Auto Send Multilevel Sensor Report (for watts) at the group time interval (whole HEM) Bit 0: Auto Send Battery Report at the group time interval (whole HEM)

Value.label: Group 3 Reports
Value.Help: Which reports need to send in group3. Format is as follows: Byte 1 (msb): Reserved Byte 2: Reserved Byte 3: Bit 7: reserved Bit 6: reserved Bit 5: Auto Send Meter Report (for kWh) at the group time interval (Clamp 3) Bit 4: Auto Send Meter Report (for kWh) at the group time interval (Clamp 2) Bit 3: Auto Send Meter Report (for kWh) at the group time interval (Clamp 1) Bit 2: Auto Send Meter Report (for watts) at the group time interval (Clamp 3) Bit 1: Auto Send Meter Report (for watts) at the group time interval (Clamp 2) Bit 0: Auto Send Meter Report (for watts) at the group time interval (Clamp 1) Byte 4 (lsb): Bit 7: reserved Bit 6: reserved Bit 5: reserved Bit 4: reserved Bit 3: Auto Send Meter Report (for kWh) at the group time interval (whole HEM) Bit 2: Auto Send Meter Report (for watts) at the group time interval (whole HEM) Bit 1: Auto Send Multilevel Sensor Report (for watts) at the group time interval (whole HEM) Bit 0: Auto Send Battery Report at the group time interval (whole HEM)

Value.label: Reset #111-113
Value.Help: Reset to default parameters number 111-113. Any value other then 0 will initiate this reset.

Value.label: Group 1 Interval
Value.Help: The interval of sending report group 1.

Value.label: Group 2 Interval
Value.Help: The interval of sending report group 2.

Value.label: Group 3 Interval
Value.Help: The interval of sending report group 3.

Value.label: Unit Recalibration (dangerous)
Value.Help: Re-calibrate (will destroy factory calibration). CONTACT AEON LABS before using.

Value.label: Device Tag
Value.Help: Device tag.

Value.label: Reset default configuration
Value.Help: Reset to the default configuration.

Value.label: Toggle the sensor binary report value when the Magnet switch is opened/closed.
Value.Help: Default setting: Open: FF, Close: 00

Value.label: Enable wake up 10 minutes when the power is switched on.
Value.Help: Default setting: Disable

Value.label: Toggle the basic set value when Magnet switch is opened/closed.
Value.Help: Default setting: Open: FF, Close: 00

Value.label: Determines which report will be sent when Magnet switch is opened/ closed.
Value.Help: Which reports need to send automatically in timing intervals for group 1. Bitsets: 0->Battery report, 4->Sensor Binary, 8->Basic Set, Default setting: 0x00000100 (Basic Set) Ideal Setting for OZW is 17 (Sensor Binary and Battery Report)

Value.label: Device Tag
Value.Help: Device Tag

Value.label: Reset configuration settings to factory defaults
Value.Help: Reset to factory defaults.

Value.label: Operation mode
Value.Help: Parameter defines device operation mode.

Value.label: Door/Window or alarm status
Value.Help: Parameter defines state of the sensor when the magnet is close. If the alarm sensor is connected, it determines the output type. Parameter inactive in external button mode (parameter Operation Mode set to 1).

Value.label: Visual LED indications
Value.Help: This parameter defines events indicated by the visual LED indicator. Disabling events might extend battery life. Values of parameters may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means opening/closing and wake up will be indicated by the visual indicator. 0 - No indications. 1 - Indication of opening/closing status change (input In). 2 - Indication of wake up (1 x click or periodical). 4 - Indication of device tampering.

Value.label: Range test after double click
Value.Help: Allows to enable activation of Z-Wave range test with double click of a Tamper Switch 2.

Value.label: 2nd Association Group triggers
Value.Help: Parameter defines events which result in sending On/Off commands to devices added to the 2nd Association Group. These commands are sent alternately to switch the devices On and Off. Commands represent the values of BASIC SET command frames. Parameter is inactive in external dry-contact mode (parameter Operation Mode set to 1).

Value.label: Commands sent to 2nd Association Group
Value.Help: Command frames sent to devices added to the 2nd association group.

Value.label: Value of ON command frame sent to 2nd Association Group
Value.Help: The value of 0 turns OFF the device, 255 turns it On. In case of associating the Dimmer or Roller Shutter module, values 1-99 allow to set an Associated device to a specified level.

Value.label: Value of OFF command frame sent to 2nd Association Group
Value.Help: The value of 0 turns OFF the device, 255 turns it On. In case of associating the Dimmer or Roller Shutter module, values 1-99 allow to set an Associated device to a specified level.

Value.label: Time delay of ON command frame
Value.Help: Time period after which On command frame will be sent.

Value.label: Time delay of OFF command frame
Value.Help: Time period after which Off command frame will be sent.

Value.label: Delay of tamper alarm cancellation
Value.Help: Time period after which a tamper alarm will be cancelled.

Value.label: Reporting tamper alarm cancellation
Value.Help: Reporting cancellation of tamper alarm to the controller and 5th Association Group.

Item.label: Do not send tamper cancellation report

Value.label: Scene activation functionality
Value.Help: The device can trigger scenes via Dry Input Terminal (external contact) using scene IDs assigned to different events.

Value.label: Tilt Sensor functionality
Value.Help: The device can report Tilt Window events. This functionality can be disabled if the device is mounted on a door or windows without tilt functionality.To disable tilt detection set the value to 0.

Value.label: LED Mode
Value.Help: In night-light mode the LED on the switch will turn ON when the switch is turned OFF, instead of following the state of the load.

Value.label: Invert Switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON.

Value.label: Ignore Start-Level (Receiving)
Value.Help: This dimmer will always start dimming from its current level, ignoring any commanded start level.

Value.label: Fault restore
Value.Help: Enable/Disable Basic Sets of 0x00 on a fault restore to nodes in Group 2
